HU-0eZnhlRH2VLPmURqFxQ.text: I had the pleasure of visiting Oak Steakhouse during Restaurant Week in early 2019.   Upon arrival I noticed what a beautiful, open atmosphere Oak offered.  We were seated at a round table in the back of the restaurant, close to the kitchen, which I loved due to the fact I could watch the execution in the kitchen.  Our waitress arrived and offered water and explained a little bit about the Restaurant Week menu and wine they were offering as part of the menu.  After reviewing the menu we decided to start with two bottles of the Red Blend for the table.   Our waitress brought the bottles, corked and allowed one member of our table to taste before moving forward with pouring for everyone.  The menu offered three Appetizer options, 5 Entree options (with 4 upgrades available) and 2 desserts. Among the 5 of us we tried several different things.  I had the Winter Salad to start.  Local greens, toasted almonds, apples, feta with a candied garlic vinaigrette, it was one of the best salads I have had in a long time.  For my entree I chose the 8 oz. Cab Filet Mignon with Whipped Potatoes and Seasonal Greens. The steak was cooked too perfection, with an amazing grilled sear, and everyone else enjoyed their steaks as well.    As for dessert I enjoyed the Lemon Olive Oil Cake, but did taste the Chocolate Cake, heaven.  All I can say it I am happy we chose Oak for Girl's Night Out, and I am looking forward to returning soon.

UPmfqmgJ_D9v-FVizzi7Pw.text: My parents came to visit my husband and I here in Charlotte recently. They always enjoy at least one really nice dinner. Still not knowing the area very well, I used my handy dandy tool Yelp! (Shocker)  We knew we wanted to be in the South Park area so we could walk around the mall post food coma. I found Oak and thought to myself 'this sounds super familiar.' Having been a recent Charleston resident I asked our server Jennifer if there was any relation. Her response was, "yes, we're all apart of the Indigo Road Restaurant Group." ***poooof mind blow**** I got super excited not getting a chance to try Oak in the Holy City, I get to try it in the Queen City now.  This only meant one thing for sure...I had to get steak. My dad and I split a 12 oz. filet which the chef was nice enough to split for us out back. My husband had the burger and my mom had the scallop appetizer. (Scallops & Burger seen in photos)  We decided on three sides (seen in picture Seasonal Vegetables & Crispy Potatoes) - seasonal vegetables, sweet potatoes and the pork belly mac n cheese. As a group we had a hard time between the crispy potatoes which came highly recommended versus the sweet potatoes. Jennifer was amazing and gave us the crispy potatoes complimentary. Between both potato dishes - I personally preferred the sweet potatoes just because I'm not a huge potato person in general.   Now my steak...holy cow (pun intended). That steak was prepared perfectly medium. It was so juicy and tender, I ate the whole thing which is super rare for me. The seasoning gave the filet some great flavor.   As a family we had a fantastic experience at Oak. If you go, ask for Jennifer. Her service was top notch and she has a great personality. Thanks Jennifer for the witty banter and amazing hospitality. We will be back!

3NTomCtnFsBa3UVPpdWENg.text: Oak is a somewhat trendy steakhouse located near the South Park shopping area.  The restaurant is pretty spacious and has very high ceilings.  When we dined here it wasn't too crowded, but the acoustics were making it a little hard to hear.  Our servers were all very friendly and made the dining experience pleasant.  We had the grilled octopus and that was the highlight of the meal.  It was cooked perfectly, very meaty and had a nice seasoning.  I would have ordered another plate of that as my entree!  For dinner I had the 8oz steak with some truffle fries.  The steak was cooked perfectly, but didn't have too much flavor.  They offered a whole bunch of sauces to dress it up, but I usually like my filet plain.  Other people in my group seemed to enjoy their entrees ranging from fish to a tomahawk ribeye.  Prices were on par with most nicer steak houses with the medium filet running $40.  Check this place out for a night out, but don't expect a quiet night or a truly top notch steak.

1arOJdynziaNbVNm6UZL_A.text: Decided to try something new instead of the chain steakhouses, and we were very impressed. Order the ribeye or filet!  Service was great, and he kept our drinks going during the whole dinner.

NklIWW087FWzftrm-hqU8w.text: What a pleasant surprise Oak was. I walked in for an early dinner and was seated right away. My waitress, Emily, was lovely and accomodating and willing to give recommendations.  I started off with a glass of cabernet and two rolls, which were hot from the oven and delicious. Emily informed me that she could do half portions of any of the salads since they are quite large and I was dining by myself. I took her up on that and got the burrata and peach salad which was just divine. Unlike most other restaurant salads, it was not drowning in dressing which I greatly appreciated and the addition of granola was an unusual but good choice.   For my main course I ordered the filet with the blackened butter (also per Emily's recommendation) and the filet was cooked perfectly. The flavor of the blackened butter was milder than I was expecting but still good (it's butter...how could it not be good) but in hindsight I wish I had gone with the horseradish cream instead since I know it's always my favorite. As a side, Emily recommended the mexican street corn and it was fabulous (important to note that it is not at all spicy, which I made sure to ask beforehand because I am not a spice lover). I was sad not to finish it since I wanted to save room for dessert. She also let me know they could do half portions of the sides as well. Even as a half portion, it was still a decent size.   Finally, for dessert I was between two options...the peach cobbler and the lemon olive oil cake. I love me a good cobbler and peaches are everywhere here so I figured it was probably the best thing to get, but something about the lemon olive oil cake was calling me and Emily confirmed that everyone loves it so I went with it and WOW. Simply marvelous. The slice they brought out was the size of my head at least (no half portions on the desserts apparently) and I could only get maybe 1/3 of the way through before I had to throw in the towel. The only downside to it was that they had obviously just taken it out of the fridge so it had that slightly-stiff fridge texture but I took the rest home, left it out overnight and ate it this morning for breakfast (don't judge me, you would do that too) and it was perfect.   The decor was very much a steakhouse feel with wood and leather everywhere but I really love that vibe. They had an outdoor patio as well that looked lovely but it was way too hot for my New England self to be sitting outside. Though I did not need it since I was there obscenely early for dinner, they do offer complementary valet parking.   Overall, I had a lovely experience here and would definitely go back and recommend to anyone in the Charlotte area.

kiJ5r8NaVwqi9AlI9KHetA.text: It was restaurant week.. So this was our chance to try a new restaurant. Oak popped up and decided to give this place a try..  Staffs: 5/5 stars. Hostess and our waiter are great..  Food: 3/5 stars. I ordered the 16 oz prime ribeye. There was an additional $15 on top of the $35 set menu. The seasoning of the steak was good..I asked for medium and it came more medium rare. It suppose to come with mashed potatoes and spinach. However, all I had was the steak and a grilled tomato. I didn't realized it suppose to come with that so I ordered the lobster Mac and cheese. And I didn't like the Mac and cheese. Plenty of lobsters, however, it tasted very bland. There were no salt on the table to change that. So I didn't finish it. The mashed potato came later and they mentioned that it suppose to be with my steak..  Their butternut squash was good. Very flavorful and have that sweetness.  The winter salad wasn't good. Didn't taste like much and it has a bitter aftertaste   Drinks: I have the lime-lemonade with a shot of gin. Which I like a lot. Had 2 of those.   Overall customer service was great. However, I'll come back to try their regular menu. Wasn't impressive with the restaurant menu.

zWXmTyrSrKvyvjUPX0r7sA.text: I really hate that I was unimpressed with Oak. My first (and last) visit was a particularly impactful one because it was on my birthday. And the rating of 3 stars is a generous one considering how quickly my experience descended from enjoyment into one of dissatisfaction. I gave it a shot in no small part due to a wonderful experience at their sushi restaurant O-ku.  When I came in on a Tuesday evening around 6pm I expected that the restaurant would be lightly attended and I could get a table outright. The place looked relatively empty save for a huge party of suits hanging around the bar drinking and mingling waiting for one large table. The hostess, however, said they only had a few high tops - one right beside her and the rest sitting out in the open by the bar - or a seat at the bar. She said it was unusual that they had three large parties that evening (though I only ever saw the one). I decided to sit for a minute and started browsing other restaurants. Finally the hostess came up to me and said "how about a booth?" I said that would be great but realized as she led me over to one of the awkwardly large and red semi-circle booths that it felt a bit uncomfortable right in the middle of everything. It seemed like they were making a huge sacrifice to seat one guy at a table meant for four. I even apologized profusely to her and the waiter. I sat in view of the bar, the TV and a very large room for parties beside the bar that I was told would be full.  My waiter was super accommodating and friendly initially. I engaged him with a genuine interest because I am not a steak connoisseur. He guided me through the differences in the steaks, sides, toppings, etc. I settled on a dry-aged 20oz ribeye cooked med-rare (the chef's suggested level according to the waiter) with the scallop Oscar on top. $64 plus $16. Before long an unexpected but free-of-charge baked oysters Rockefeller came out. These things were delectable and I had to confirm that they were a regular item on the menu. After this I started to rethink making a cocktail order and despite preferring a Manhattan usually, I got a Saskatoon by the waiter's suggestion. Meanwhile, bread came out that was nothing at all to praise. Basic rolls with butter. But we came here for the steak didn't we?  My cocktail came out and the steak followed it. The waiter had recommended the Brussels sprouts as a side but I didn't order them for fear of having too much food. Despite that, he brought a side of them out to me at no charge. It was generous and I thanked him. But in the end I didn't like them at all. Something to do with the pickling of the onions on top was off-putting. I let him know my thoughts and in the end I didn't take them home. At the same time I was trying to sip my cocktail but it was too powerful. I know bartenders like to be generous with the alcohol in things but it was too much. The citrus bitters were also overpowering and I had to leave this drink sitting on the table with more than half remaining in the glass. The steak was good but I truly wish I had gone up a level with the doneness and got medium. I'm not usually a rib-eye-guy (filet FTW) but you can quickly tell that these marbled steaks need a little longer on the grill to melt and disperse the fats throughout. By the time I had eaten the more cooked parts around the edge, the steak was getting hard to cut with the knife I had and the drink/Brussels sprouts combination was not sitting well on my stomach. I was ready to get the check and go but the waiter was ghost for a long period of time.  When he finally showed up again I mentioned the check but I made the mistake of asking to review the dessert offerings first. I didn't order anything but let the waiter know I didn't care for the Brussels sprouts or the drink. He even clued me in that it was probably the pickling of the onions - he knew his stuff. The drink, despite being visibly more than half full, was never mentioned. I saw the manager reply to other reviews that Oak "always" offers a replacement drink if you're not satisfied. It was never comped and a replacement was never even offered although I thought I gave the waiter plenty opportunity.  As I paid my bill and stood up to leave something hit me hard: the restaurant was still mostly empty save for the one large party from before. The large room across from me never filled. Several small 2 and 4-person tables elsewhere sat empty the entire time. Was I being screwed with? This point was most frustrating because it punctuated the beginning and end of my experience. I felt more like I was in the way with being accommodated rather than an appreciated guest. As I left, the same hostess asked if I enjoyed myself. I replied honestly with "Eh, it was alright." to which she replied with "Well, have a good evening." The highlight? Despite my direct complaints and obvious dissatisfaction with several things, not once did I hear a "sorry".

2lfrKsGtjIlBL433Kds_Cg.text: Such a cool place with incredible drinks and food! Our waitress Megan was so nice as well as the manager, bartender and other staff members. We can't wait to go back!

fNh7ijxKnSzrIrtQonADmg.text: I came to the restaurant for happy hour. i was kindly greeted by the staff and I told them I was there for their happy hour. They told me I can have a seat anywhere at the bar or selected tables reserved for the bar. The restaurant is really nice and upscale, yet it was dark with lots of wood and leather texture which makes the atmosphere more relaxed. I ordered the oak burger and it came with truffle frittes as well as the pork belly mac and cheese. The burger was huge and I loved how they charr the brioche bun to give it a crisp taste. The meat tasted fresh and the flavor was good. Perhaps some specialty sauce would've been great but the burger was traditional style. The mac and cheese was so delicious and it wasn't salty even though it had a generous amount of cubed pork belly. My server was really pleasant and I liked that I was able to walk in with really casual clothes and not be looked upon like some upscale restaurants would do. The manager was really sweet and made sure my friends and I were being attended properly. Will be back!

d0q9HXTjTV3BMTdZ_KTdbQ.text: Enjoyed my first dinner last night. The food was outstanding. The octopus and pork ravioli  appetizer was excellent. I ordered the Salmon that had a perfect caramelizing on top and was super flavorful. Another had steak that was cooked perfect. Dessert was a gluten free chocolate cake that was dense but not too sweet. We didn't request gluten free but our waiter Zach suggested it and glad he did. I would definitely order it again.  And the restaurant decor is very cozy and welcoming. Overall first impression was very good. Great place for a date night and also great for business dinners  Update 4/25/19 This is my second time going to Oak. I took my wife here for our 24th anniversary. I made a note on my reservation that this was our anniversary. From the check in to my table waitress to the manager, they all acknowledged that this was our anniversary. To me that means that they are really interested in each person and reservation that comes to this restaurant. The manager came by two or three times checking on us, our waitress Jennifer was truly outstanding, and the quality of food was even better than my first visit. I think this Oak was probably the best service and attention I have ever had at a restaurant. There's an old saying that you get what you pay for. Oak truly lives up to that statement and even more

photos.caption: Photo of Oak Steakhouse Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Oak Steakhouse Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

Q8X1_f0zhq5FQ28MpFipUA.text: I went for my birthday and everything was amazing! The Food, Drinks and Staff were all 5 star!!

qpNrW3V4-kjPG2EmP5WQ0A.text: So I just made a reservation on Monday, for Tuesday night, for me and my wife to celebrate our 36th wedding anniversary. I was asked while making the reservation if we had been there before and was there anything we were celebrating. I informed the hostess that it was our first time there and yes we were celebrating an anniversary. They gave me a couple of options for a time to book and we then confirmed what we wanted.  We showed up 10 mins in advance of the reservation, which presented no problem to be immediately seated in a round booth that could have seated six people, but was great for just the two of us. Shortly after being seated the floor manager stopped by to welcome us, he wanted to recognize that he knew it was our first time there and he appreciated we chose them to celebrate our anniversary.  Immediately after or server Nina came by to introduce herself to us and also wanted to recognize us for first time there and she knew we were celebrating an anniversary. She brought us some water and asked us for any other drink order to be placed. We ordered a glass of wine for my wife and a martini for me. When Nina came back with our drinks she also had complementary glasses of champagne to toast our anniversary. She asked how many years and then said that's worth having your picture taken, which she then took.  After giving us some time she came back to describe the menu, how they prepare their steaks and offered a couple of specials not on the menu. She mentioned that she really liked the smoked octopus as a starter. I told her that sounded very good but I had decided on the oyster Rockefeller, my wife got the bib salad. When the appetizers showed up the manager stated they had added the smoked octopus on the house so we could try it. Since my wife does not like dishes like this I enjoyed it by myself, it was excellent, along with the oysters.  We both had the 8oz filet, with sides of roasted asparagus and Crispy potatoes. I chose the scallop Oscar for the top of my steak. The food was outstanding and Nina stopped a couple of times to check on, pour us more water, or get a glass of wine. We were never rushed and enjoyed a fantastic meal with great service.  So we informed Nina we had zero room for dessert and could she bring us the check. She asked if any of the desserts had caught our eye, and my wife talked about two she said if she had eaten less she might have split with me. So a little while later Nina shows up with a free dessert to celebrate our anniversary and stated she would bring a to-go box.  We have eaten at a number of high end steak houses all over the US and abroad. This experience was a five star experience for us and I would highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oak Steakhouse Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheers
Photo of Oak Steakhouse Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Surprise dessert

sldzfogti8_fVqoQUx0inw.text: This is your quintessential steak house. Big leather booths, dim lights and a comfortable atmosphere. The way the booths are set up allows you to be able to have a private conversation and not hear everything your neighbors are saying. We had the Oysters Rockefeller and steak tartar for apps, both of which were good. For our main course we ordered the 90 dry aged ribeye and the mixed grille. The ribeye was cooked perfectly medium rare but was on the salty side. So if your thinking about ordering this you may want to tell them to hold the sea salt flakes they add at the end. Everything on the mixed grill was cooked and seasoned well, and we enjoyed he variety of meats/cuts. Overall, all of the food was good and it's pretty much exactly what you would expect from a nice steak house.

8qCRUIM5lDOSh8bT7aa27w.text: WOW. What to say... this steakhouse will blow you out of the water. The food is absolutely amazing and the service is even better! Aaron took care of us and the service was impeccable. Make sure to try the pork belly Mac and cheese. The NY strip is to die for. Will be back soon! Maybe even this week!

vq6Sv8JNSHXezNhYoTj1Zg.text: Unbelievable food and excellent 5 star service. First time trying oysters Rockefeller, delicious! Loved the bib salad, tried the steak tartare but it's not my thing, my companion raved about it. Had the ny strip and lamb for dinner with the brussel sprouts and crispy potatoes, took more than half home for leftovers! Highly recommend the old fashioned cocktail and wine list. Finished the meal with espresso and a slice of the delicious creme brulee cheesecake. Definitely returning soon!

sbsnzcPHx18zYy_oaQiLNg.text: I was very impressed with this place during the soft opening last Monday night .... We got there a little early and sat at the bar for a while so we got the whole experience... Great food, Great service (thank you, Micheal & Alex) would definitely go again...Highly recommended for a nice night on the town with a special someone.

og_AxxCYdBhXScIwfPjmNw.text: Beautiful steak. By far top 3 best filet mignon I've ever eaten. Literally melt in your mouth. A must try if you're in the area.

W-5bUB14GWK4Z738lK4NuA.text: On Sunday you have to go to brunch. I love the Oak Skillet and the french toast, not to mention the cinnamon rolls. :) Yummy! Also, the Mac and Cheese is amazzzing!!! its a favorite.

vCI-JDewROQ-EaNrjkm41Q.text: From the moment we walked in our experience was flawless. The restaurant is stunning, the food was beautiful and the service was outstanding. We had an assortment of starters, salads, steaks, sides and dessert. Top to bottom we enjoyed our meal. Can't wait to go back!

8w73HmE0nee1TNMWFl2JYQ.text: It is extremely impressive that Oak presented us such a fine experience on its 5th night of being open.  Decor is lovely; very welcoming staff; and service by Matthew was impeccable.  The octopus appetizer was the best I have ever had (including Italy!), and the porterhouse and truffle fries were divine.  Their other restaurant, O-Ku, is a favorite, as well; Oak is a welcome addition to the Southpark restaurant dining scene.  I'm looking forward to returning, AND to their addition soon of a Sunday brunch!

ywsYXpqIapae8JzMidnT-g.text: Absolutely LOVE this new Steakhouse in Charlotte!  Beautiful Restaurant and fabulous service while dining at the bar.  Our Bartender Greg was FABULOUS!!!  Very attentive and offered suggestions, completely knowledgeable about the menu.   Can't wait to go back, thank you!

bnnbmcvOX87luF_lRarYEA.text: We celebrated our 10 year anniversary there. Our waiter Zack was the best!! The food was prepared perfectly!! Great ambiance within the restaurant. This Steakhouse will fit in the Southpark area well.

eoY4ielhxmOYL1eE-GuoZw.text: Eh.  I agree with several of the other people here. I love a great steakhouse and was so excited to try this one. However, it was quite unmemorable.  We had a party of 8 for NYE... the decor and ambience were inviting. Our service was fine but nothing to get excited about; empty glasses were left on our table throughout the meal... water was refilled sparingly. I asked for my steak to be rare; it was brought out medium well.  If I am paying 60+ for a steak, it should be cooked properly. It was replaced awhile later.  No apologies, no warm sides, etc. Instead, I found myself eating while the others were close to done.  I would much rather head to BLT, Bentley's, or one of the many other steakhouses in CLT.  Disappointing.

2hWAcKo8nh4VRLYLiZg2xw.text: Went to this restaurant last night and was very impressed. It is a very nice restaurant perfect for date night. our waiter Samuel was a pleasure from beginning to end. I had the ribeye steak it was delicious the best in Charlotte in my opinion. The oak house homemade sauce on my steak was great. The oyster Rockefeller was great.  I definitely will be return

SoQJXqnGdds1YlQgRhjUQw.text: Had brunch here with friends recently and was not impressed. Ordered a french press and cinnamon roll to start. The coffee had so many grinds in it they had to make a new one. The middle of the cinnamon rolls were raw. We also ended up ordering chicken and waffles, a breakfast skillet, grits and eggs Benedict. The Benedict and skillet were good, not great, just good. The chicken and waffles were pretty terrible. Soggy waffles and a chewy piece of chicken thigh. The grits were chewy and unappetizing. Blah!

ZbfTUriMH6KgXIJ1i9-l8g.text: Went for my wife's birthday, and from start to finish : one of the best dining experiences ever. Hospitality, service, and especially the food. Oysters Rockefeller, the ribeye, pork belly Mac and cheese, fried succotash, and the carrot cake. Made our night very special. Def going back!

CkFave2znyYVkktAKof02g.text: After returning from our trip to NC and posting two horrible reviews, I just had to write a glowing review of Oak.  We went there two nights in a row just because the burgers were the best we've ever had.  The restaurant is pretty and clean and the service is excellent. The manager (think his name was Jason-was outstanding).  If you get a chance, not to be missed this place.

pyq79Qe77TpShWd7fTozxw.text: Unfortunately things could have been better I realize they still have growing pains but Here's what we found :SAM who took care of us when we had a drink was excellent!! Bruce who came by and talked to us was at first humorous and that was nice however he needs to know when to go back to work  Emily who was our waitress was very good at first but when we had a few minor complaints she turned sour even after we told her we knew it wasn't her fault and my friends told her she looked mad  she never recovered came to table to check on us but couldn't get away fast enough Food for the price was OK but for the prices they charge should have excellent Soup was served with no spoon we asked 2 times for spoon I had to get up find Sam and he brought us a spoon  Justin the manager came over to see how things were two people had to sent their entree back to have it heated up Justin did take care of a couple of items off bill for our trouble but we told him staff needs to be re-trained to give better service I stopped at bar after friends left and Tanner at bar was very good I go to 3 other fine steak restaurant in Charlottr and never had any problems  I am a firm believer in giving everyone a 2nd chance but my friends won't be going back to this restaurant  I have never worked in the restaurant business but think I could a good job managing this place

-7xOwu930nHHKn6OpdggMw.text: Food is about four stars but service is three stars at best. Arrived in a pouring rain and can not find any valet parking within a hundred feet of the entrance. In fact the parking situation is very dicey as there is rarely any parking available for the restaurant. Ordered our drinks and then ordered a bottle of wine and our food. The food came and an additional glass of wine was ordered but after five minutes the waiter had to be reminded that the glass of wine had not arrived.  A pasta dish that was ordered was not available but we were not told that until just prior to the entrees being served so there was only time to take their substitute entree of another pasta rather then decide on another dish if we had been told about the pasta not being available soon after the order.  The wine list is pretty inclusive. The prices are the same as at Capital Grill but the service does not equal that at Capital grill.  If your reservations are for a  rainy night I suggest you cancel so you stay dry.

Udjz6PF4JG94-IVkO6-65Q.text: Had dinner here tonight, it was a great experience and delicious. The waitstaff were awesome, humorous and more than able to put up with our table after we'd had a few cocktails. We had the tuna tartare lettuce cups, the carpaccio, and the oysters Rockefeller. My only gripe was that the oysters mainly tasted of bacon and breadcrumbs, no oyster texture or flavor. Three of us had the filet, one the half rack of lamb, and we shared some Truffle fries and Brussel sprouts. The meat was cooked perfectly, the flame grill really does make a difference, the sauces that came with the meats were all also tasty. The Brussels weren't a hit for us, they came in a really aggressive oil and spice mixture that was kind of off putting. The truffle fries serving was HUGE and tasty. For dessert we got the ice cream sandwich (on the house) and the crime brulee cheesecake, the ice cream sandwich was a little weird because the cookies were super hard and difficult to eat. The cheesecake however was soooooooo good. The majority of the meal Was delicious, the service was excellent, if at times a little too excellent---a runner or waiter asked if we wanted more bread at least 4-5 times. $500 for 4 people is a little steep--the above food,  a few cocktails, a bottle of red wine and tip--especially in South Charlotte. But hey, sometimes quality is worth the price and I'd say at Oak that holds True.

ZiljqCoa2ywD9YCJlVZ6rQ.text: My boyfriend and I went for brunch last Sunday. We were thoroughly impressed with how smoothly the service was considering it was the first brunch service since the restaurants opening. The service was great and the food came out in a timely fashion. As expected, the food was delicious. I got the lobster frittata and he got the pork belly eggs Benedict, both were delicious. Overall, it was a great experience.

J8U0crTKizX2RxG8wdg5sQ.text: Went to dinner here last night... food was very good... but some problems early on when the hostess sat us said to my adult daughter as she handed her the menu...'there you go sweetie'.  To me she said 'darling.  I'm not overly formal, but think this type of familiarity is misplaced in a restaurant like this. Friendly server, but service was very slow - we had to ask for our apps, for dishes to be cleared, for water....  We expected more

R_8c3ihZOMK3ocDxnJU-NQ.text: I went to The Oak for the soft opening on Monday night - 5.8.17.  Michael was a great server & the food was awesome.  I will definitely be going back once officially opened!!  Highly recommended.

IWPJAflTaJi7VWhC7Rujxg.text: I tried a couple steakhouse in Charlotte. Let me tell you, this place is by far my favorite steakhouse. SO WORTH THE MONEY. The food were AMAZING. The steak was cook perfectly (medium well done). I can't say the same about the cocktails... but the food made up for it so it deserved the whole 5 stars lol

6gdz1XSgf7eIhIvIe_6yRg.text: The food was perfection, service was incredible, and the atmosphere couldn't have been more perfect.   Jennifer, Justin, and the rest of the staff made our 1st wedding anniversary absolutely perfect.  The dry age beef was tender and delicious, second best steak Of my life!  The fillet was well seasoned and cooked perfectly.  We ordered the decanter of Manhattan, definitely the way to go.  Best Manhattan I've had in Charlotte.

RBAePKCTkzCfwlbRXeHrpw.text: Fantastic restaurant experiences. Food is excellent - we've tried the salmon, chicken, and filet and all were above expectations. The service is also above and beyond. We've celebrated multiple occasions and each time was surprised with complementary drinks and appetizer.

ku3PCVxekkScoq75TpUW5w.text: Had a great Father's Day meal! Atmosphere is modern and overly noisy. Waiters are accommodating to changes and questions. The rack of lamb was the highlight of the meal, but the chocolate cake was yummy. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oak Steakhouse Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thumbs up for the chocolate cake

AT_MovN88TLdM7gXkL4bbQ.text: This was my first time visiting Oak Steakhouse. We arrived with a reservation and were promptly seated and our waiter, Zach offered a superb variety of cocktails and appetizer choices. We started with a pork ravioli that had a great flavor. For the entree we had 8oz filet and 16 oz Ribeye, the temperature of the steaks was perfection and with the suggestion of the waiter we added the lobster macaroni and cheese. We were surprised with a fabulous creme brulee for dessert with a champagne toast to top off our fabulous evening. I would highly recommend Oak to my friends and family.

w0YK1-LDDTRfGT2IbRrpww.text: My wife and I dined at Oak last night for Valentine's Day and it was simply, okay. We arrived five minutes past our reservation, but weren't seated for another fifteen minutes (understandable for a holiday), however the big problem for me was that we were first seated at a hightop table no more than 8 feet from the host station, practically in the lobby. We asked to be moved and were moved to the next table over, but at least it wasn't a high top table.  Our waitress was wonderful! Very pleasant, very kind, and full of recommendations about the menu. She absolutely gets a 5 star, the rest of the experience, not so much.   We ordered drinks, we were really excited for the bar menu. My wife ordered a Carolina Summer and I ordered a Saskatoon. My wife's drink tasted like a unsweetened La Croix water and mine tasted like a concoction of essential oils with a little bit of alcohol. I was very surprised that, for the price ($15+) the bar was so light on their pours. I would not recommend ordering drinks here.   We ordered a salad to start, which was plenty large enough to share. Two steaks, a side of frites, and the grilled broccoli. The steaks were very good, almost great! The sides were par, especially the frites which were essentially your average fries with a little too much salt and garlic on top. The broccoli was good, and again, almost great.   I think this restaurant is close to being really good, but until they become more liberal with their alcohol pours and can boost the quality of their sides, I think it is an overpriced step-up from an Outback, etc. We ended our night by going to Firebirds in Ballantyne for some after-dinner drinks and honestly, probably will go straight to Firebirds next time.

GFvAxcKK_nJQhW1a20TyzA.text: We were a party of five here for my birthday. Overall the welcome and getting seated was fine. The front staff seemed a little distracted or maybe startled when we arrived, but were kind enough. We were offered to be seated while we wait for the rest of our party who was parking. To be honest, after reading the reviews and knowing this restaurant group, I was expecting a bit of fun. I would describe it as more somber than anything. But our server did well with asking if everything tasted good.   We ordered some drinks to get started. While $16 can seem a little steep for a cocktail (and yes, I know this is a nicer restaurant, I'm just tired of the $15 to $16 cocktail), our drinks were really tasty and seemed to have been made with skill and attention. Side note, the bar area is beautiful and the Oak Manhattan is exceptional.   We each ordered burrata salad, one person in our party got the vegetable soup, though they didn't actually order it and had just asked the server what the soup of the day is. To be fair, the person who asked what the soup of the day was had mostly lost their voice a little so it wasn't a big deal. The burrata though--I could eat the burrata salad every day of my life! It was so good!   For the main course everyone except me ordered the filet and I got the 16 oz. ribeye. We also ordered several sides. For sides we got the pork belly mac n cheese, the assorted mushrooms, collard greens, and truffle frites. None of the sides were bad, none unfortunately none of them were all that memorable either. About half our table wasn't big on the dry, hard, chunks of pork belly in the mac. I personally thought it was delicious. My steak came out medium, but I had ordered it medium rare. I did expect a perfect cook here for a $54 steak. This was not a huge deal and I didn't want them to throw it away as waste, so I didn't mention it to the server. I know they would have recooked it if I mentioned it. Our server was kind and very friendly. There were maybe two times when we needed something and waited a little while. Over all a great addition to the South Park restaurant scene and well worth a visit.

6Eu1jhCywINV3_JJ5K-Vhg.text: The service, decor, music and most important the food, were all fantastic. You definitely get what you are paying for here.

yf3tM11JPMrrCqMPQX9e4Q.text: Oak Steakhouse exceeds my expectations every time. Most recently I celebrated my birthday with them and they went above and beyond!! The food is excellent but the service is unmatched. They surprised us with Prosecco and then added a complementary side of truffle frites, which are to die for. And even though we were stuffed and couldn't eat dessert they sent us home with a peach cobbler to enjoy later. We will definitely be back!!

Wq6SorYcT9M1euNaN4FYQw.text: First time here. Parking was fairly easy. Place was full but not crazy busy for a Saturday night. Had an 8:15 reservation. Asked for a booth which they gave us. The booth request seemed to throw hostess a little. Menu was pretty straight forward for steakhouse. The prices lead me to think they are wanting to grab some of Del Fiscos and RC customers. I had the pork chop which was very tasty and the risotto was great. The mixed vegetables that came with it were terrible. I would suggest some steamed broccoli for a choice. Wife had the filet and I did taste it and it was ok. We also got the whipped potatoes and the sauteed vegetables. The potatoes tasted like they were from a box and were very dry. The sauteed vegetables were just ok. We also started the meal with the cheese board and while a few of the items were pretty good (meats mainly), the 2, yes 2 cheeses were just ok. There also should have been some cranberries. The main reason I said the cheeses were just ok was because the center portion of both cheeses were softer, by the time we started making it to the outer portion, it was to hard to cut. I had the Caesar salad which was very good. I will always give a place a second shot to redeem a mediocre first time but we dropped over $200 here without buying a bottle of wine and if I'm going to do that, the entire meal better be more than just ok. I leave these reviews for 2 reasons. One that they management reads them and makes some changes and 2 so that others have something to compare when they do take the time to review.

yuyRfKNqzZilXFNf5r5svA.text: I was very excited to eat at this restaurant because it has a great reputation in other cities . We were a big group so we sampled much of the menu. The steaks were okay but the sides were awful ( very salty !). We spoke with the manager and gave him our feedback. Normally most restaurants would offer some sort of compensation ( free dessert / take the sides off the bill) , however this manager interaction was very awkward - he barely spoke with us, but did not apologize and walked away. Very disappointed. Will not be going back . If you want a good steak house check out BLT or STK.

2YlTea3JYtOvmfybRrHxpw.text: I received a recommendation to go to Oak.  As I was a lone diner, the suggestion was to eat at the bar.  It was a great meal, phenomenal service from Sharon.  I plan to go back in the near future with my wife.

kH1XepcGO0Yf7AGaP_Tsdw.text: The food was absolutely fantastic. Jennifer is the best waitress I have ever had. She was kind, personable, conversational, and did an absolutely excellent job serving us. Make a reservation here and ask for Jennifer as your waitress.

ZD8llNxBXKUHUIb-s9JDgQ.text: Loved this restaurant. The decor was really upscale but still comfortable and the service was spectacular. As a vegetarian who occasionally eats fish, there aren't usually a ton of options for me on a steakhouse menu but I had some tough choices to make last night. Everything we ate was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend the scallops, crabcakes, and the cheesecake. Oh man, that cheesecake... Can't wait to go back!

p_DiP6bnSjnzPcMLxAbjvQ.text: Just wrapped up our first visit, and we're walking away full, happy and bursting with praise for this place. Driving by crowds at other South Park spots I want to yell - get your butts to Oak for brunch. I'm a picky person about service and the people of Oak are amazing! Decor and music - on point! We started off with a french press of Pure Intentions, along with chocolate chip banana bread and cinnamon rolls. Both were delicious but the bread was my favorite due to the combination of ooey gooey chocolate and the crisp but not burnt bottom. My fiance ordered the skillet for her main - the homemade sausage and gravy were a hit! My lobster frittata didn't disappoint - they didn't skimp on the lobster and I loved the touch of lemon on the micro greens. Our server Sam surprised us with chocolate cake to go for my fiance's birthday- such a sweet gesture! Definitely coming back for dinner soon!

Photo of Oak Steakhouse Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

NRZ20FAo7dISc44kQb7CYg.text: The last time I ate here, I gave this place 5 stars. This time my experience was the exact opposite; full disclosure, this time I ate here for an industry presentation in the restaurant's conference room on someone else's dime. An hour and a half into the conference (the presentation had actually already concluded by then) we still hadnt been served our main courses, so I had asked for everything to go 30 minutes prior (1 hour in) to 2 different servers 15 minutes apart; nothing was done. I didn't want to make a scene, but I left the restaurant hungry, disappointed and never even saw or tasted my main course after having been at the restaurant for more than 90 minutes.

opQx_Db-wCp5YyZktIUiQg.text: Thank you Sharon who recommended this place and thank you Aaron for making our anniversary a great one. A good steak was all we wanted but we got more! The experience and hospitality everyone gave us was a 10/10 I order the filet mignon, and my boyfriend order the recommended bone in aged steak. I ate more of his than I did mines. No A1 sauce needed, salt or pepper. Medium rare to the perfection. Sides were tasteful and the jalapeno corn bread is still in my fridge bc we had so much food and I didnt want waste it. Lol Their drinks came out perfect, the manager came by to thank us for coming there for our special day and gave us a glass each of champagne, which we did not expect. They made us feel welcome, appreciated and spoiled. I didnt mind which plate came out first but Aaron made sure to course us, everything came out perfect. We enjoyed it very much and will be back for those yummy steaks!

870QE17mRFCBGyMOztUaxg.text: Pros: Sophisticated, intimate, warm, delicious.  On May 8th, I attended one of Oak's VIP open nights. My friends and I arrived just before our 8:15pm reservation and we were immediately and warmly greeted by friendly faces at the host stand. We were then promptly led to a beautiful and comfortable booth where we received excellent service. Every single staff member we interacted with was incredibly knowledgeable, professional, and welcoming. The food was truly unbelievable and I had- without a doubt- one of the best steaks of my life. The ribeye was cooked to perfection and exactly the way I ordered it. Oak is currently awaiting their liquor license, but the wine list was impressive and the sake/wine based cocktails that were being offered that night were wonderfully executed.  There are always a few kinks to be worked out when any new business/restaurant opens but any slip ups made by Oak staff were minor and easily corrected or went unnoticed altogether. There really is no end to the positive things I can say about Oak. The decor is elegant and stylish without any air of pretentiousness, the staff is at the top of their game and very well versed in everything Oak has to offer, and the food is beyond compare. Every single person involved with Oak has clearly worked immensely hard and they are ready to be the best steakhouse in Charlotte. I am already eagerly anticipating my next meal there. You should too.

BREajmI5hrLzzDT360dN-Q.text: Really good if you want to impress a business associate (or spouse)! I had the NY Strip medium rare and it was prepared perfectly. A good steak does not need excessive seasoning or be drowning in butter. Sides were exceptional, especially the brussel sprouts. Even if you don't like brussel sprouts, you might love these! Service was excellent and very attentive.

m13BIiKUAYSqY46ga9codQ.text: I really wish I could give this place more stars.  It's beautiful and the service was awesome.  I just can't get past the food and the wine selection.  We sat at the bar and ordered four items to share and only one I would order again.  We started with the meat and cheese plate.  It was fine, I didn't love the meats but that could just be my preference. We also ordered the filet with truffle fries on the bar bites menu (specials before 6:30.)  It was a great steak, cooked perfectly and the fries were to die for.  It was also a great value at $18 for a five ounce steak.  We also had half of an oak salad which was fine but over dressed.  The grilled octopus was super tender but also super salty.    The wine list and by the glass list could use some work.  The service from the female bartender was awesome.  She was very attentive and she comped us for a bottle of wine that we drank half of and just couldn't get past the weird flavor of the wine.  I would come back for a cocktail and those amazing fries!
